marketNews.title: Wall Street Journal reports that US President Donald Trump is considering choosing and announcing the replacement for Fed Chair Jerome Powell in September or October 2025 to weaken Powell's position. Powell's term officially ends in May 2026. Reuters reports that the main candidates for Fed Chair after Powell's term includes former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, former White House National Economic Council Head Kevin Hassett, current Fed Governor Christopher Waller, and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent. Trump on Wednesday (25/6) called Powell "very bad" for not cutting interest rates sharply. Meanwhile, Powell told the US Senate that interest rate policy must be cautious due to the risks posed by Trump's tariff plans to increase inflation.
marketNews.content: Wall Street Journal reports that US President Donald Trump is considering choosing and announcing the replacement for Fed Chair Jerome Powell in September or October 2025 to weaken Powell's position. Powell's term officially ends in May 2026. Reuters reports that the main candidates for Fed Chair after Powell's term includes former Fed Governor Kevin Warsh, former White House National Economic Council Head Kevin Hassett, current Fed Governor Christopher Waller, and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent. Trump on Wednesday (25/6) called Powell "very bad" for not cutting interest rates sharply. Meanwhile, Powell told the US Senate that interest rate policy must be cautious due to the risks posed by Trump's tariff plans to increase inflation.

marketNews.title: The Directorate General of Taxes of the Ministry of Finance explained that the plan to collect Article 22 Income Tax (PPh) from online traders through marketplaces aims to strengthen oversight and close the gap of the shadow economy, according to a Bloomberg Technoz report. A Director at the Directorate General of Taxes, Rosmauli, stated that the plan targets online traders who have not fulfilled their tax obligations, either due to a lack of understanding or reluctance to face administrative processes deemed complicated. Rosmauli mentioned that the regulation regarding the appointment of marketplaces as Article 22 PPh collectors is still in the finalization process internally within the government. Previously, Reuters reported that the tax amount to be imposed would reach 0.5% of the sales revenue of sellers with annual turnover between 500 million rupiah and 4.8 billion rupiah. Reuters sources also stated that the regulation could be announced as early as next month.
marketNews.content: The Directorate General of Taxes of the Ministry of Finance explained that the plan to collect Article 22 Income Tax (PPh) from online traders through marketplaces aims to strengthen oversight and close the gap of the shadow economy, according to a Bloomberg Technoz report. A Director at the Directorate General of Taxes, Rosmauli, said that the plan is aimed as oversight for online traders who have not fulfilled their tax obligations, either because of lack of understanding or because they are reluctant to face the administrative processes considered complicated. Rosmauli mentioned that the regulation regarding the appointment of marketplaces as Article 22 PPh collectors is still in the process of finalization internally within the government. Previously, Reuters reported that the tax amount to be imposed would reach 0.5% of the seller's sales revenue having an annual turnover between 500 million rupiah and 4.8 billion rupiah. Reuters sources also said that the regulation could be announced as early as next month.

marketNews.title: Chairman of Qilaa International Group, Sheikh Abdulaziz Al-Thani, said on Thursday (26/6) that his company will make an initial investment of approximately 2.5 billion US dollars in a project to build 1 million affordable homes in Indonesia. Al-Thani mentioned that they will immediately construct 50,000 apartment units.
marketNews.content: Chairman Qilaa International Group, Sheikh Abdulaziz Al-Thani, said on Thursday (26/6) that his company will make an initial investment of approximately 2.5 billion US dollars in a project to build 1 million affordable homes in Indonesia. Al-Thani mentioned that they will immediately build 50,000 apartment units.

marketNews.title: Head of the Legal Department of the Indonesian Life Insurance Association, Hasinah Jusuf, stated that the consolidation of State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN) insurance companies will not impact the business of private insurance companies. Hasinah's statement emerged after COO of BPI Danantara, Dony Oskaria, announced a consolidation plan for 16 BUMN insurance companies, including BUMN-affiliated companies such as AXA Mandiri, BNI Life, and BRI Life. Dony explained that BUMN insurance companies are currently small and not competitive enough.
marketNews.content: Head of Legal Department of the Indonesian Life Insurance Association, Hasinah Jusuf, said that the consolidation of the BUMN insurance companies will not have an impact on the business of private insurance companies. Hasinah's statement emerged after COO of BPI Danantara, Dony Oskaria, announced a consolidation plan for 16 BUMN insurance companies, including BUMN affiliated companies such as AXA Mandiri, BNI Life, and BRI Life. Dony explained that the BUMN insurance companies are currently small in size and not competitive enough.

marketNews.title: It's time to stop misunderstanding Breakouts and Market Direction
marketNews.content: "Liquidity is important because it becomes a price target." - Prabaniswara

tickerNews.title: Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) recorded bank-only net profit of 1.6 trillion rupiah in May 2025 (-7% YoY, +6% MoM). This result brings the 5M25 net profit to 8.5 trillion rupiah (-1% YoY), relatively lower than the consensus expectation which projected 2025F consolidated net profit to grow +4% YoY.
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) recorded bank only net profit of 1.6 trillion rupiah in May 2025 (-7% YoY, +6% MoM). This result brings the 5M25 net profit to 8.5 trillion rupiah (-1% YoY), relatively lower compared to the consensus expectation which projected 2025F consolidated net profit to grow +4% YoY. On a monthly basis, BBNI's net profit in May 2025 showed a post-Eid recovery, but with a relatively weaker recovery compared to Bank Mandiri ($BMRI) and Bank Central Asia ($BBCA). Based on the 5M25 performance realization, we see indications of a decline in BBNI's performance in 2Q25 compared to 1Q25, unless there is a significant performance improvement in June 2025 from the April-May 2025 level. DPK and Credit Slow Down As of May 2025, BBNI's credit growth was at +7% YoY, slowing down compared to the level as of March 2025 at +9% YoY and below the management's 2025 consolidated guidance in the range of +8-10% YoY. We assess this slowdown occurred along with tight liquidity, which is reflected in the Third Party Funds (DPK) which only grew slightly by +1% YoY as of May 2025, slowing down from a growth of +5% YoY as of March 2025. The Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) rose again to 94.5%, nearing the management's 2025 guidance limit of 95%. Limited credit growth room and tight liquidity caused Net Interest Income (NII) to only grow +3% YoY during 5M25. Non-Interest Income (Non-II) which only grew slightly by +1% YoY and opex which rose +6% YoY caused Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) to be flat year-on-year during 5M25. Provisions Expense Increase Provision expense recorded a decrease of -18% MoM, but still increased by +5% YoY in May 2025, so that during 5M25 provision expense rose +2% YoY. We highlight the increase in provision expense in April-May 2025, where the average provision expense reached ~670 billion rupiah per month, higher than the average in 1Q25 at ~500 billion rupiah per month. This increase is also reflected in the Cost of Credit (CoC) which rose from 0.8% in 1Q25 to 0.9% during 5M25 (vs. 5M24: 1%), although still below the 2025 guidance in the range of 1%. Key Takeaway With a high LDR position that is almost reaching the management's target limit, we assess that liquidity easing becomes the main factor to restore growth room for BBNI. The increase in provision expense in the last 2 months will also be our focus at the 2Q25 earnings call. Furthermore, we also see the potential for a downward revision of the 2025F net profit estimate by consensus, after revisions of -5%/-11% in the last 3/6 months. From a valuation standpoint, BBNI traded at 0.8x 1-Year Forward P/BV as of Thursday (26/6), almost touching -1 Standard Deviation (0.77x) below the 5-year historical average. At this level, we see BBNI offering a minimum dividend yield of 7%.

tickerNews.title: PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, a subsidiary of Petrindo Jaya Kreasi ($CUAN) and controller of Petrosea, purchased 91 million PTRO shares at an average price of 2,220 rupiah per share on June 24, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 202 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada's ownership in PTRO increased from 44.385% to 45.287%.
tickerNews.content: PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, a subsidiary of Petrindo Jaya Kreasi ($CUAN) and controller of Petrosea, purchased 91 million $PTRO shares at an average price of 2,220 rupiah per share on 24 June 2025. The total transaction value reached ~202 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Kreasi Jasa Persada in PTRO increased from 44.385% to 45.287%.

tickerNews.title: Medco Energi Internasional ($MEDC) announced it has signed an agreement with Repsol E&P, S.a.r.l. to acquire Fortuna International (Barbados), Inc. as the indirect owner of a 24% stake in the PSC Corridor. The transaction value reached 425 million US dollars or ~6.9 trillion rupiah, and is expected to be completed in 3Q25. The PSC Corridor has 7 gas production fields and 1 oil production field, all located onshore in South Sumatra. MEDC explained that gas sales from the PSC Corridor are conducted through long-term contracts to 'reputable' buyers in Indonesia and Singapore. CEO of MEDC, Hilmi Panigoro, stated that this acquisition is in line with the company's strategy to own and develop high-quality assets that generate strong cash flows.
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi Internasional ($MEDC) announced it has signed an agreement with Repsol E&P, S.a.r.l. to acquire Fortuna International (Barbados), Inc. as the indirect owner of a 24% stake in the PSC Corridor. The transaction value reached 425 million US dollars or ~6.9 trillion rupiah, and is expected to be completed in 3Q25. The PSC Corridor has 7 gas production fields and 1 oil production field, all located onshore in South Sumatra. MEDC explained that gas sales from the PSC Corridor are conducted through long-term contracts to "reputable" buyers in Indonesia and Singapore. CEO of MEDC, Hilmi Panigoro, said that this acquisition is in line with the company's strategy to own and develop high-quality assets that generate strong cash flows.

tickerNews.title: Adaro Andalan Indonesia ($AADI) announced it has sold ~3.68% share ownership in Cita Mineral Investindo ($CITA) to a subsidiary of Alamtri Minerals Indonesia ($ADMR), PT Alamtri Indo Aluminium, for ~572.8 billion rupiah or 3,934 rupiah per share. AADI explained that the proceeds from the share sale will be used to strengthen its financial position, while ADMR stated that the purchase of CITA shares was done to enhance its investment portfolio.
tickerNews.content: Adaro Andalan Indonesia ($AADI) announced it has sold ~3.68% share ownership in Cita Mineral Investindo ($CITA) to a subsidiary of Alamtri Minerals Indonesia ($ADMR), PT Alamtri Indo Aluminium, for ~572.8 billion rupiah or 3,934 rupiah per share. AADI explained that the proceeds from the share sale will be used to strengthen financial position, while ADMR stated that the purchase of CITA shares was done in order to enhance investment portfolio.

tickerNews.title: Surya Citra Media ($SCMA) controller, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), announced it purchased ~668.2 million SCMA shares at an average price of ~159.5 rupiah per share during the period of June 12-25, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~106.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 64.02% to 64.92%.
tickerNews.content: The controller of Surya Citra Media, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), announced it has purchased ~668.2 million $SCMA shares at an average price of ~159.5 rupiah per share during the period 12-25 June 2025. The total transaction value reached ~106.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 64.02% to 64.92%.

tickerNews.title: Indika Energy ($INDY) signed a multicurrency credit facility worth 203 million US dollars and 2.8 trillion rupiah from Bank Mandiri ($BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI), Bank DBS Indonesia, and Bank UOB Indonesia. This facility is intended for the full repayment of a 250 million US dollar credit facility agreement dated March 2, 2023, and to fund the Awak Mas gold mining project managed by the company's subsidiary, PT Masmindo Dwi Area.
tickerNews.content: Indika Energy ($INDY) signed a multicurrency credit facility worth 203 million US dollars and 2.8 trillion rupiah from Bank Mandiri ($BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI), Bank DBS Indonesia, and Bank UOB Indonesia. This facility is intended for the full repayment of the credit facility agreement worth 250 million US dollars dated March 2, 2023 and to fund the Awak Mas gold mining project managed by the company's subsidiary, PT Masmindo Dwi Area.

tickerNews.title: Pakuwon Jati ($PWON) shareholders on Wednesday (25/6) approved the plan to distribute 2024 fiscal year dividends of 626 billion rupiah or 13 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 30% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 21%) and indicates a dividend yield of ~3.5% as of Thursday (26/6). The cum date and payment date have not yet been announced.
tickerNews.content: Pakuwon Jati ($PWON) shareholders on Wednesday (25/6) approved the plan to distribute 2024 fiscal year dividend of 626 billion rupiah or 13 rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to 30% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: 21%) and indicates a dividend yield of ~3.5% as of Thursday (26/6). Cum date and payment date have not been announced.

tickerNews.title: Adi Sarana Armada ($ASSA) will distribute 2024 fiscal year dividends of ~185 billion rupiah or ~76% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~71%). This amount is equivalent to a final dividend of 30 rupiah per share and indicates a final dividend yield of ~4.1% as of Thursday (26/6). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is July 3, 2025, while payment will be on July 25, 2025. Previously, ASSA distributed an interim dividend of 20 rupiah per share in November 2024.
tickerNews.content: Adi Sarana Armada ($ASSA) will distribute 2024 fiscal year dividend of ~185 billion rupiah or ~76% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~71%). This amount is equivalent to final dividend of 30 rupiah per share and indicates a final dividend yield of ~4.1% as of Thursday (26/6). Cum date in regular and negotiation market is July 3, 2025, while payment is on July 25, 2025. Previously, ASSA has distributed interim dividend of 20 rupiah per share in November 2024.

tickerNews.title: Apexindo Pratama Duta ($APEX) announced the acquisition of a jack-up rig drilling contract worth 7.4 million US dollars or ~120 billion rupiah from PT Pertamina Hulu Mahakam for a work duration of 3 months.
tickerNews.content: Apexindo Pratama Duta ($APEX) announced the acquisition of a sea drilling contract worth 7.4 million US dollars or ~120 billion rupiah from PT Pertamina Hulu Mahakam for a work duration of 3 months.

tickerNews.title: Bank Victoria International ($BVIC) controller, Victoria Investama ($VICO), purchased ~390.2 million BVIC shares at a price of 115 rupiah per share on June 18, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~44.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, VICO's ownership in BVIC increased from 52.01% to 54.13%.
